result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:26 PM Defendant Michael W Schroeder appeared by zoom video, in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Attorney Brandon Carson for attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Michael W Schroeder. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Defendant to be released on 10/14/2022.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:16 AM Defendant Michael W Schroeder in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Michael W Schroeder in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to drug testing through WCS.   Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant is to report to WCS within 24 hours.

Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing May 1, 2022. (BC)

LF 4/25--mailed copy of Order and payment letter to defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 09:25 AM Defendant Michael W Schroeder in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  The Court takes a short recess at 9:28 AM.  Matter recalled at 10:39 AM with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing May 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
